I looked into it, and both eveolution and creationism are correct. No thanks, please, I am just being a good person...
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Oh, why they are both correct: Simple: They both exist: Creationism states the Universe was created... which it was, and evolution states animals evolved from other animals, which is correct also (a human is born from another human, with that human's genes, therefore, that newly born human has evolved with genes from both parents).
 
 If you want to argure some, well, this is no debate forum, so you can not argure... wait... damnit!

Creationism does not state the universe was created, it states the earth was created ~6000 years ago, man lived with dinosaurs, and geology, biology, astronomy, physics and chemistry are all wrong in major ways when it comes to dating layers of the earth and fossils, if not guided by satan or an evil atheist network to deceive man.
 
 It doesn't really make any falsifiable predictions itself, so it can hardly be considered a theory, more a collection of crackpot ideas and imagined conspiracies.

Creationism does not state the universe was created, it states the earth was created ~6000 years ago, man lived with dinosaurs, and geology, biology, astronomy, physics and chemistry are all wrong in major ways when it comes to dating layers of the earth and fossils, if not guided by satan or an evil atheist network to deceive man.
 
 It doesn't really make any falsifiable predictions itself, so it can hardly be considered a theory, more a collection of crackpot ideas and imagined conspiracies.

 
 False, creationism is merely a belief in a supernatural deity that created everything.
 
 
I looked into it, and both eveolution and creationism are correct. No thanks, please, I am just being a good person...
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Oh, why they are both correct: Simple: They both exist: Creationism states the Universe was created... which it was, and evolution states animals evolved from other animals, which is correct also (a human is born from another human, with that human's genes, therefore, that newly born human has evolved with genes from both parents).
 
 If you want to argure some, well, this is no debate forum, so you can not argure... wait... damnit!

 
 False, Creationism states that the universe was created by a Creator. This cannot be verified, therefore it is incorrect to claim it is true. Evolution is nearly fact, creationism as a belief in a supernatural deity may be true.

Innacurate;
 Young Earth Creationism (YEC) states that the Earth/Universe was created between the 11th and 18th November 4004 BC as stated in Genesis. The date having been derived from the collected ages of persons mentioned in the OT. 
 Variations on the theme range out to an age of 25,000 years (Archangel; no data given of course).
 The general excuse for geological data is that it was all deposited during the Flood, (No explanation for clear stratification). The excuse for Astronomical data is that the speed of Light slowed down, (Again no reason for this)
 
 Old Earth Creationism (OEC) concedes that the geological and astronomical data are correct but maintains that all extant species have been around since day 1 (Or day 6 if you want to be pedantic) and "Macroevolution" does not occur, (even when it is observed).
 
 Belief that the Universe was created then Animals (+ Lifeforms including plants fungi and bacteria) evolved is THEISTIC EVOLUTION.

While we're on the subject, I've managed to conclusively disprove Intelligent (sic) Design. It's actually a remarkably simple thing to do when you realise that Nature is just far too complex to have been designed.
 
 Look around you. We humans are perhaps the best designers that we know of. Look how crude are the things we make: the filthy, inefficient combustion engine; the computer, unable to make decisions of its own and unable to feel emotions; the microwave, unable to cool anything like a tasty meal. We are, at best, crude emulators of Nature.
 
 No. No designer could possibly have kept track of all the interlocking wonders of the natural world, therefore there can't possibly have been one.
 
 Also, the chances of a designer appearing ab initio in the Universe are of the order 1 in 5x10^90871. I worked it out.
 
 I'll let the Discovery Institute know.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Both theories are correct
